description: From Old French ensorceler (“to cast a spell, enchant; to captivate”), a variant of ensorcerer, from en- (prefix meaning ‘caused’) + sorcier (“sorcerer”) (ultimately from Latin sors (“fate, lot; oracular response”), from Proto-Indo-European *ser- (“to bind”)).

verbs.description: ensorcell (third-person singular simple present ensorcells, present participle ensorcelling, simple past and past participle ensorcelled) (British spelling)
